narrative.fact: Kenny Rueter built a PVC sprinkler toy for his kids and shared a how-to video online before starting a company.
He struggled to monetize the instructional video and lacked an integrated way to sell digital content directly.
Rueter and Travis Rosser founded Kajabi in 2010 to package the software stack digital entrepreneurs needed in one place.
The first Kajabi release integrated website, content hosting, and payment tools so creators could launch online businesses without stitching services together.
By February 2022 the company reported 51,000 active users across 138 countries using the platform.
Kajabi positions itself as an all-in-one knowledge commerce platform with site builder, email, analytics, mobile app, and Kajabi Payments with no revenue share on sales.
The pricing page states Kajabi has helped over 75 million customers, 100K+ businesses, and delivered $10B+ in creator revenue.

story_judgement.reason: Founding pain and solution are documented; user scale and creator earnings are reported on the official site and corroborated by public profiles.
